bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 21, 1949

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that Ireland is in the hospital. The Reed Memorial Association plans to place plaques on the building where Reed died at the next meeting of the group, which Hench will attend.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 21, 1949
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
February 21, 1949
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your note of February 5th. We are
delighted that you are safely back at home again. I am sure that
you must have had a very interesting trip through Europe.

I am sorry to tell you that General Ireland is gradually be-
coming less active and is now in hospital.

We shall look forward with very great pleasure to seeing you
at the next meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association at
which time we can carry into effect the installation of the plaques
at Fort Lesley J. McNair.

closer.signed: J. F. Siler, Col., U.S.A., Ret'd
